name: PhanphanOS
description:
Introduction

This game is a submission for the mini JameGam#13. It was made in two days.

Find out the source code here : https://github.com/AudergonV/MiniJameGam13 (kinda messy)

Short description

This point-and-click game is simulating a desktop where you need to provide to your boss a file that he has asked to you.

Controls

  • Left click : grab some object
  • Right click: show options of the object

Credits

This game was made by :

  • Audergon Vincent : welcome animation and code
  • Felder Camille : graphics

Logiciels used :

  • Code and game rendering : Godot Mono 3.3
  • Affinity Designer on iPad (version 1.10.5) and on Desktop

Have fun :)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Solution (⚠️this contains some spoilers ⚠️)

  • Delete all the files on the desktop and response to your boss
  • You need to get the ball that the cat play with. To do this :
    • Open the SudVPN :
      • Japan : Get the katana by clicking on it
      • Italia : Cut the string in the winter season
      • France : Cut the branch of the tree that is a little bit creacked
      • Canada : Click on the hook that is hidden on the sign
    • Put the string, the branch and the hook in the "build" folder and drag-and-drop it on the wrench. You'll get the fishing rod.
    • Open the SudVPN :
      • Canada : Click with the fishing rod on the lake on the summer season. You'll get a fish.
      • Japan : Give the fish to the cat. It will gives you the ball.
  • Throw the ball on the bin two times to recover the important file.
  • Open the SudVPN an other time and go to Italia in the summer season. Then, click on the plant at the right and click on the key next to get it.
  • Drag and drop the key on the important file
  • Put the file on the cloud to send it to your boss. And then.. surprise ! (not implemented, ran out of time :'( )

⚠️ Your boss will call you many times to hurry you. The game has a timer, at the end of it, there is a consequence. (or not)
